The central bank anticipates inflation will fall below two percent in early 2026. Japan's economy is projected to grow moderately. Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is preparing for a snap election on February 8.

articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

Enshrined among the Fundamental Rights, this provision was designed to reassure minorities of cultural and educational security in a newly [ ] The post Article 30 and the Balance Between Minority Autonomy and State Regulation appeare

articles.title: How Capital Gains Tax Differs Across ETFs, Equity and Mutual Funds
articles.summary: This explains how different securities are taxed under Indian income-tax law. The key takeaway is that asset classification, not just holding period, determines the tax rate. The post How Capital Gains Tax Differs Across ETFs, Equity and Mutual Funds appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Hyderabad Condoned 506-Day Delay; Ad Spend Allowed; Alleged Coerced Share Sale Ground Admitted
articles.summary: The Tribunal condoned a 506-day delay after accepting that the appeal was filed only when heavy penalty exposure created prosecution risk. The key takeaway is that bona fide reliance on legal advice and later developments can constitute sufficient cause for condonation. The post ITAT Hyderabad Condoned 506-Day Delay; Ad Spend Allowed; Alleged Coerced Share Sale Ground Admitted appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: CA Withdraws Appeal as Final Removal Order Not First Challenged Before Single Judge
articles.summary: The High Court held that a direct appellate challenge to the final removal order was not maintainable. The appeal was withdrawn with liberty to file a fresh writ against the removal order. The post CA Withdraws Appeal as Final Removal Order Not First Challenged Before Single Judge appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Service Tax Demand After Death Unsustainable; Legal Heir Not Covered u/s 65(7): Orissa HC
articles.summary: Orissa High Court held that legal heir cannot fall within ken of Section 65(7) of the Finance Act, 1994 hence proceedings under section 73 of the Finance Act determining service tax after the death of the service provider is unsustainable in law. Accordingly, the present writ petition is allowed. The post Service Tax Demand After Death Unsustainable; Legal Heir Not Covered u/s 65(7): Orissa HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.summary: Downdetector tracks outages ​by collating status reports from a ‌number ‍of sources, including user-submitted ‍errors on its platform. The actual ‌number of affected users may differ from what's shown on Downdetector because these reports are user-submitted.

articles.title: Intel struggles to meet AI data center demand as PC chip squeezes margins
articles.summary: The forecast underscores the difficulties faced by Intel in predicting global chip markets, where the company's current products are the result of decisions made years ago. The company, whose shares have risen 40% in the past month, recently launched a long-awaited laptop chip designed to reclaim its ‌lead in personal computers just ‌as a memory chip crunch is expected to depress sales across that industry.

articles.title: Amazon plans nearly 30,000 corporate job cuts next week, sources say
articles.summary: Amazon is planning a second round of job cuts next week ‍as part of its broader goal ​of trimming some 30,000 corporate workers. The company in October cut some 14,000 white-collar jobs, about half of the 30,000 target.

articles.title: DLI 2.0 may shift from reimbursements to equity-linked support
articles.summary: The government is redesigning its Design Linked Incentive (DLI) scheme 2.0 for semiconductor companies, shifting from reimbursement-based support to equity- or debt-linked funding with stronger IP oversight. The new scheme may support larger chip design projects and retain strategic intellectual property in India. However, final details and approval are still pending.

articles.title: China, Hong Kong hold India’s chip supply reins
articles.summary: China remains India’s top chip supplier, accounting for nearly 30% of integrated circuits and micro assembly shipment worth $5.78 billion in April–November FY26, while Hong Kong contributed 18.5%. US shipments surged, but Taiwan’s supply fell. Overall, India sourced chips from 64 countries, slightly down from last year.

articles.title: Budget 2026 must prioritise job creation, support to exports: FICCI's Industry Survey
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Businesses are calling for the Budget to focus on creating jobs and boosting exports. Global trade challenges are a key concern. Companies are optimistic about India's economic future. They expect strong GDP growth and support for sectors like manufacturing and defence. Fiscal prudence remains important. The budget will be presented on February 1.

articles.title: India deeply engaged on trade matters: Vaishnaw on Trump's remarks on US deal
articles.summary: Following Donald Trump's optimistic statement about a "good" trade deal with India, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw expressed encouragement, highlighting India's significant role in global trade. Trump, speaking at the World Economic Forum, praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "fantastic man" and a friend, underscoring his respect for the Indian leader.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Exporters seek tax, tariff relief on February 1
articles.summary: India Budget: Indian exporters are calling for government support in the upcoming Union Budget 2026-27. They seek tax, tariff, and financing measures to combat global protectionism and revive export growth. Key demands include correcting inverted customs duty structures and developing Indian shipping lines. These steps aim to reduce costs, boost competitiveness, and strengthen India's position in international trade.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Industry leaders urge govt to double infra spending to Rs 3 lakh crore
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: Industry leaders are urging the government to double infrastructure project allocations to Rs 3 lakh crore in the upcoming Budget. This significant increase is seen as crucial for boosting economic growth, enhancing supply-chain efficiency, and positioning India as a global economic powerhouse. Key demands include reforms in logistics, warehousing, cold-chain, and renewable energy infrastructure.

articles.title: ET@DAVOS: How Geopolitics, Agentic AI, and Gen Z talent are rewriting the growth playbook
Budget 2026 could drive a power shift in India’s semiconductor push
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: The nation aims to become a top chip manufacturing hub by 2032. Several major projects are underway, with production expected to start in 2026. The budget must ensure sustained policy support and timely incentive disbursements to maintain momentum and attract further investment in this crucial sector.

articles.title: Union Budget 2026: Fiscal policy to turn pro-growth as government moves to target debt-to-GDP, economists say
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's fiscal policy is set to favor growth as the government shifts its focus to a debt-to-GDP ratio target from April 2026. This move is expected to lead to a gentler pace of fiscal tightening. Economists anticipate gross borrowings to reach record highs, though net borrowings may remain stable, potentially impacting bond markets.

articles.title: India Budget 2026: Resilience balance - revenue miss, deficit unchanged
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's fiscal health is strong, with its deficit halved post-pandemic. The upcoming Budget 2026 will assess fiscal arithmetic and outline priorities. While nominal GDP growth is slower than budgeted, a stronger FY25 base offers comfort. Revenue misses are expected due to GST rationalisation and tax relief. Higher dividends will offset this.

articles.title: What Goldman Sachs, Jefferies, HSBC, 5 others expect from Union Budget FY27
articles.summary: As the Union Budget FY27 nears, financial experts anticipate a careful balance between fiscal discipline and economic growth. Key expectations include sustained capital expenditure, particularly in infrastructure and defence, alongside conservative tax policies. Investors will closely watch measures aimed at boosting consumption, manufacturing, and exports, while the fiscal deficit remains a critical market indicator.

articles.title: Rs 4.5 lakh crore PSU bank rally draws FII buying in 10 stocks. Are you late to the party?
articles.summary: Foreign investors are significantly increasing their stakes in Indian public sector banks, drawn by a remarkable rally and improving financial health. These banks are now outperforming private lenders in loan growth, signaling a strong turnaround. Despite recent gains, analysts believe many PSU banks still offer attractive valuations, making them a compelling investment opportunity.

articles.title: KEI Industries among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open Interest
articles.summary: KEI Industries saw a sharp surge in futures open interest, emerging among five F O stocks signaling rising trader interest and potential near-term volatility.

articles.summary: A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern that forms when the opening price is the lowest and the closing price is the highest for a given session.

articles.title: United Spirits shares in focus after Adar Poonawalla signals bid for RCB acquisition
articles.summary: United Spirits shares are set to be in focus after Serum Institute CEO Adar Poonawalla said he plans to make a strong and competitive bid for the Royal Challengers Bengaluru IPL franchise, currently owned by the Diageo-controlled liquor maker. The development comes against the backdrop of a sharp rise in United Spirits’ December-quarter profit, even as revenue growth remained modest.

articles.title: Stock market may stay range-bound near term, but new highs likely by year-end: Nitin Raheja
articles.summary: Indian equities are navigating a period of consolidation with improving growth prospects for FY27. While near-term market movements may be range-bound, a stronger earnings recovery could propel indices to new highs by year-end. Valuations have become more attractive compared to other emerging markets, offering a better risk-reward setup.

articles.title: ETBudget Boardroom| Budget 2026 should focus on continuity, bond market development and funding India’s growth internally: A Balasubramanian
articles.summary: India's economic resilience amidst global turmoil is highlighted, with policy continuity, bond market development, and domestic funding mechanisms identified as key Budget priorities. The nation's fiscal consolidation and real asset creation provide a strong foundation for sustained growth, positioning it favorably for future expansion.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk| Budget 2026 to prioritise capex and policy continuity over big-bang reforms: Niraj Kumar
articles.summary: Budget 2026 is expected to prioritize growth support and macro stability, with a focus on capital expenditure and fiscal discipline. Niraj Kumar of Generali Central Life Insurance anticipates a revival in earnings growth, driven by domestic demand and policy continuity, making India structurally well-placed despite geopolitical uncertainties.

articles.title: Bharat Electronics among 6 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
articles.summary: An uptrend signal is generated when the RSI crosses above 50 from below.

articles.title: DLF shares gain over 1% after turning gross debt-free, Q3 net profit rises 14% YoY
articles.summary: DLF shares are in focus after a strong Q3 performance. The company reported a 14.4% jump in net profit to Rs 1,207 crore. DLF also achieved a significant milestone by becoming gross debt-free for the first time since its 2007 IPO. Strong operating performance and consistent growth from its annuity business contributed to these positive results.

articles.title: Mphasis Q3 profit up 3.5% YoY to Rs 442 crore
articles.summary: Indian mid-tier IT firms showed mixed performance in Q3 FY26, affected by seasonal softness and labour code changes. Mphasis posted a 3.3% YoY profit rise to Rs 442 crore, while Cyient’s profit fell 25% to Rs 91.8 crore. AI-led deals and BFSI growth helped offset some challenges across the sector.

articles.title: Go Digit Q3 net profit rises 18% to Rs 140 crore on premium growth
articles.summary: For the new-age insurance startup, gross written premium, which is the total premium collected before deducting expenses, climbed to Rs 2,909 crore from Rs 2,676 crore in the corresponding period of the previous year. Also, its net retention ratio fell to 73.8% from 83.8% a year earlier, indicating a higher proportion of risk being ceded to reinsurers.

articles.title: Why New Delhi isn’t losing sleep over the rupee
articles.summary: The Indian rupee is falling as foreign investors withdraw funds and the RBI sells dollars. A trade deal with the US could reverse this trend. India's economy is strong and can absorb higher import costs. The US focus on tariffs may keep oil prices low, aiding India's growth. Washington will eventually reconsider its tariff policy, benefiting the rupee.

articles.title: ETBudget Boardroom | Capex, R&D push and tax reforms key expectations from Budget 2026: Vikas Khemani
articles.summary: As India prepares for Budget 2026, Carnelian Asset Management's Vikas Khemani emphasizes sustained growth through enhanced capex execution and R&D investment. He advocates for meaningful tax reforms, including addressing double taxation on dividends and STT, to boost investor confidence and long-term momentum.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech
articles.summary: India-China trade: India's industrial growth faces a new challenge as China restricts technology transfers. This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: No refund if you cancel late. Railways tighten rules for Vande Bharat, Amrit Bharat trains: Check new norms here
articles.summary: New ticket cancellation rules are now in effect for Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat II trains. Passengers cancelling confirmed tickets less than eight hours before departure will receive no refund. This change aims to reduce last-minute cancellations and improve berth utilization. These premium trains operate on a 100% confirmed berth policy, unlike regular trains.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan addresses media on VB-G Ram G Act | LIVE
Blackstone finalises structured investment deal in AI cloud startup Neysa
articles.summary: US firm Blackstone has finalised a structured investment in Mumbai-based AI cloud startup Neysa, initially putting in $50–75 million. The deal allows Blackstone to increase its stake to a controlling position if certain business milestones are met. Neysa was was last valued at $120-130 million, and has raised $50 million in funding across two rounds till now.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the Mightiest - How understanding fiscal policy & government spending will help you make money in the stock market
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. By now we have a fair idea how the RBI, with its control over interest rates and money supply, acts as a crucial hand on the economic tiller. There is, however, another hand at work, one that operates more directly: Fiscal policy. And this is the domain of the government. And it is expressed through the Union Budget, slated for February 1. Understanding the budget is thus crucial. In this series, Macro the

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.summary: Investec said that Paytm's deep tech capabilities and embedded merchant relationships provide long-term pricing power and create high switching costs.

articles.title: ideaForge shares fall 5% after losses widen despite topline growth in Q3
articles.summary: At the end of the December quarter, ideaForge had an orderbook of ₹350.8 crore from ₹164 crore at the end of the September quarter. Order backlog is now at the highest for the year at ₹440 crore. 12% of its order book came from the Defence segment, while the rest came from Civil orders.

articles.title: Amazon to lay off thousands in second wave of job cuts within three months
articles.summary: A Reddit group for Amazon employees say the layoffs could be announced on January 27 or 28. Discussion on January layoff at the company show two employees from Poland were already axed this week.

He also noted positive US-India relations and discussed US-China trade dynamics. Rubenstein advised Indian policymakers to embrace global private credit and equity investments to foster local entrepreneurship and retain talent within India.

The number of investment inquiries and advisory support requests has skyrocketed, more than doubling in frequency.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Ashwini Vaishnaw flags India’s growth strength, export resilience amid global tariff turmoil
articles.summary: India is set to become the world's third-largest economy. This growth is driven by infrastructure investment, inclusive development, manufacturing, and simplified laws. The nation is also building resilience against global trade shocks. India is emerging as a key player in AI and semiconductors. These advancements position India for sustained long-term growth.

articles.title: India to keep growing 6-8% in real terms in next 5 years: Ashwini Vaishnaw at Davos
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow robustly by 6-8% in real terms over the next five years, according to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He highlighted significant improvements in telecom tower installation times, reducing them from 270 days to just 7. Discussions at the World Economic Forum also emphasized the need to boost per-capita income and diversify trade relationships.

articles.summary: India's focus on making technology accessible and scalable is drawing global attention at the World Economic Forum in Davos. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw highlighted India's approach to using AI and digital platforms for broad-based growth. Global leaders are recognizing India's progress in semiconductors and AI. States are also leveraging Davos for collaborations and attracting investment, showcasing cooperative federalism.

The blueprint, presented at Davos, spans Maharashtra, Assam, and Jharkhand, aiming to boost employment and align with India's growth priorities like energy transition and manufacturing self-reliance.

ICEYE has signed a €1.4 billion contract with Germany for a new satellite constellation, while Skild AI has raised over $1.4 billion to build software that acts as a “brain” for robots. Both founders said investor interest in deep tech has increased and India could play a role in future robotics manufacturing and supply chains.

The upcoming summit is expected to finalize an FTA, a defense partnership, and a mobility agreement.

While some benefits have been reduced, this extension offers continued support. Furthermore, a potential India-EU Free Trade Agreement, expected soon, is poised to boost several labor-intensive sectors.

articles.title: US inflation data: Fed’s preferred gauge stays above target; January rate cut pause in focus
articles.summary: US inflation stayed high in November, exceeding the Federal Reserve's target. This suggests policymakers will likely hold interest rates steady. Consumer spending showed strength, but economists warn of weakening fundamentals. The Fed is assessing earlier rate cuts and new trade pressures. Core inflation also remained elevated, indicating slow progress on price stability.

He predicted robots may outnumber humans and help eliminate poverty, while cautioning on associated risks. Musk also discussed Tesla’s FSD rollout and a potential SpaceX IPO.

articles.title: Davos 2026: Geoeconomic tensions top business risk for 2026, says WEF's Saadia Zahidi
articles.summary: The World Economic Forum’s Global Risks Report says geoeconomic confrontation is the top risk for 2026 and the next two years. Business leaders are worried about tariffs, investment controls, access to critical resources, and supply chains. Geopolitical and state-based conflicts are the next major concerns, according to WEF Managing Director Saadia Zahidi.

articles.summary: Observing that release on probation does not wipe out the stigma of conviction, the Supreme Court set aside the Madras High Court's decision that reduced a workman's punishment merely because he was granted the benefit of probation in criminal proceedings. “…the High Court has fell into error by observing that the conviction of the workman herein shall not be a disqualification and this conviction alone is not a ground to remove the workman from service.” , observed a bench of Justices Prashant

articles.title: Aspirant Solely Responsible To Check Recruitment Exam Updates: MP High Court Refuses To Relax Mandatory Timelines On Medical Grounds
articles.summary: Image by: Shubha Patidar The Madhya Pradesh High Court has held that candidates participating in a recruitment process are solely responsible for regularly monitoring the official exam website for updates and instructions. articles.summary: The Gauhati High Court while refusing to interfere with the award of a Public Works Department contract for construction of a Circuit House at Udalguri, held that an allegation of cartelisation raised by an unsuccessful bidder based solely on a common photograph enclosed with site-visit certificates of two competing bidders cannot be accepted in the absence of any concrete material showing breach of the integrity commitment under the tender. articles.title: Families Of Disabled Combat Personnel Deserve Liberal Approach In Compassionate Appointment Claims: Orissa High Court
articles.summary: “People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to suffer violence on their behalf,” the Orissa High Court quoted George Orwell as it upheld the direction of a Single Bench, which ordered compassionate appointment as Head Constable in favour of the wife of a former Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) jawan who sustained grave injuries and disability in a bomb blast while on combat duty in 2007. articles.title: Kerala Court Hears Rahul Mamkootathil For Bail In Third Rape Case, Arguments To Continue On Saturday
articles.summary: Principal District and Sessions Court, Pathanamthitta on Thursday (January 22) heard detailed arguments in the regular bail application of Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil in the third rape case alleged against him. After hearing Mamkootathil's counsel and the prosecution for some time , Sessions Judge N. Harikumar �posted the case on Saturday (January 24) for further hearing. articles.title: “Being Over Sensitive”: Delhi High Court Tells TV Today, Says Newslaundry's Criticism Not Necessarily Disparagement
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court on Thursday told TV Today, which owns news channels India Today and Aaj Tak, that it was being “over sensitive” of the videos made by digital platform Newslaundry by alleging that every comment made is disparagement or defamatory. A division bench comprising Justice C Hari Shankar and Justice Om Prakash Shukla said that while one of the videos impugned by TV Today was questionable, other videos were mere comments which were critical but not disparaging. articles.title: Loose Sheets + Retracted Statement Not Enough for 69A On-Money Addition: ITAT Chennai
articles.summary: The issue was whether third-party diaries and loose papers could establish receipt of unaccounted income. The Tribunal ruled that such papers, without authorship verification or corroboration, cannot fasten tax liability. The post Loose Sheets + Retracted Statement Not Enough for 69A On-Money Addition: ITAT Chennai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 163 Inapplicable Without Direct or Indirect Income Flow to NRI: ITAT Hyderabad
articles.summary: This ruling clarifies that an assessee can be treated as an agent of a non-resident only if income is received directly or indirectly for the NRI. In the absence of such receipt or business connection, representative assessment fails. The post Section 163 Inapplicable Without Direct or Indirect Income Flow to NRI: ITAT Hyderabad appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: IBBI Suspended RVO for Granting Provisional Membership to Ineligible Valuer
articles.summary: The regulator held that provisional enrolment has no legal basis under valuation rules and suspended the organisation for violating mandatory eligibility requirements. The post IBBI Suspended RVO for Granting Provisional Membership to Ineligible Valuer appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: IBBI Cancelled Registered Valuer Registration for Loss of RVO Membership
articles.summary: The regulator held that expulsion from a Registered Valuers Organisation breaches eligibility under valuation rules. Continuous RVO membership is mandatory to retain registration. articles.title: GST SCN Contested for Want of Proper Officer Jurisdiction: Calcutta HC
articles.summary: The Court examined whether a show-cause notice under Section 74 was issued by a competent authority. Limited protection was granted while permitting a response to the notice. The post GST SCN Contested for Want of Proper Officer Jurisdiction: Calcutta HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Delhi Quashes Search Assessments for Mechanical Approval u/s 153D; Entire Proceedings Held Non-Est
articles.summary: The Tribunal examined whether prior approval under Section 153D was granted after due application of mind. It held that mechanical and routine approval invalidates the assessment, rendering the search assessment void. The post ITAT Delhi Quashes Search Assessments for Mechanical Approval u/s 153D; Entire Proceedings Held Non-Est appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed for Invalid Sanction u/s 151: Approval by PCIT Instead of PCCIT Held Void
articles.summary: The reassessment was challenged for lacking approval from the correct authority under Section 151 after three years. The Tribunal held that sanction by an incorrect authority vitiates jurisdiction, rendering the reassessment void. The post Reassessment Quashed for Invalid Sanction u/s 151: Approval by PCIT Instead of PCCIT Held Void appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Oppression and Mismanagement in Companies
articles.summary: This analysis explains how majority control can oppress minority shareholders and how mismanagement harms companies. The key takeaway is that law intervenes only when conduct is unfair, continuous, and prejudicial. The post Oppression and Mismanagement in Companies appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Not Payable on Statutory Fees Collected by Electricity Regulators: P&H HC
articles.summary: The Court held that petition, ARR processing, and licence fees collected while performing statutory regulatory functions do not constitute taxable supply under GST, leading to quashing of the show cause notice. The post GST Not Payable on Statutory Fees Collected by Electricity Regulators: P H HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Corporate Guarantee to Subsidiary Under GST Lens: Bombay HC to Decide
articles.summary: The Court will examine whether corporate guarantees issued by a parent company to its subsidiaries amount to a taxable supply under GST, while granting interim protection against coercive action. The post Corporate Guarantee to Subsidiary Under GST Lens: Bombay HC to Decide appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Change of SFIO Probe is Procedural, Not Review: NCLAT Chennai
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal held that substituting the investigating agency did not amount to a review or recall. Since the original investigation order remained intact, the appeal was dismissed. The post Change of SFIO Probe is Procedural, Not Review: NCLAT Chennai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST Order Cannot Go Beyond SCN; Statutory Breach Not Technical: Calcutta HC
articles.summary: The High Court held that a GST adjudication order cannot be based on grounds not mentioned in the show cause notice. Both adjudication and appellate orders were set aside for violating Section 75(7). The post GST Order Cannot Go Beyond SCN; Statutory Breach Not Technical: Calcutta HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Income Tax Recovery Without Supplying Assessment Order Copy Invalid: Delhi HC
articles.summary: The Court ruled that recovery of tax without supplying the assessment order lacks authority of law. Refund with interest was directed unless the order is traced and served by a specified date. The post Income Tax Recovery Without Supplying Assessment Order Copy Invalid: Delhi HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 87A Rebate Cannot Be Denied for STCG and LTCG: ITAT Indore
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that Section 87A rebate applies to STCG and LTCG taxed under Sections 111A and 112 when income is within ₹7 lakh. The denial based on system logic and future amendments was rejected. The post Section 87A Rebate Cannot Be Denied for STCG and LTCG: ITAT Indore appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Plaint Rejected: NCLT, Not Civil Court, Has Jurisdiction over Debt & Fraud: Delhi HC
articles.summary: Delhi High Court held that issues relating to debt and fraud is within the jurisdiction of NCLT to be determined in accordance with IBC. Resultantly, the power of a civil court to entertain the present suit is, therefore, statutorily barred. Accordingly, the plaint is rejected. The post Plaint Rejected: NCLT, Not Civil Court, Has Jurisdiction over Debt   Fraud: Delhi HC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: NCLT Cannot Decide Trademark Title Disputes Dehors Insolvency Process: SC
articles.summary: The issue was whether the NCLT could declare ownership of a trademark during CIRP. The Supreme Court held that title disputes not arising directly from insolvency fall outside Section 60(5) jurisdiction. The post NCLT Cannot Decide Trademark Title Disputes Dehors Insolvency Process: SC appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Auditing in Dubai’s Gems & Jewellery Industry: Key Challenges with their Solutions
articles.summary: The article explains how evolving regulations and global reporting standards affect jewellery audits. It concludes that continuous professional training and auditor–management coordination are vital. The post Auditing in Dubai’s Gems   Jewellery Industry: Key Challenges with their Solutions appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Turnover Suppression Found, But Only Profit Element Taxable: ITAT Patna
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that while fee suppression was established during survey proceedings, the entire difference could not be taxed. Only the gross profit on suppressed receipts, excluding GST, is chargeable to tax. The post Turnover Suppression Found, But Only Profit Element Taxable: ITAT Patna appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: No Adverse Inference Allowed Without Rejecting Books or Stock Records
articles.summary: The decision reiterates that when books of account, sales, and inventory are accepted, purchase disallowances cannot be made mechanically. Suspicion cannot replace proof in tax proceedings. The post No Adverse Inference Allowed Without Rejecting Books or Stock Records appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 143(3) Order Invalid as Assessment Had Abated on Search Date
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that completion of assessment after search, despite statutory abatement, is impermissible. Jurisdiction shifts exclusively to Section 153A proceedings. The post Section 143(3) Order Invalid as Assessment Had Abated on Search Date appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Corpus Fund Withdrawal Not Taxable When Used for Charitable Objects: ITAT Chennai
articles.summary: The issue was whether utilisation of corpus donations for expenditure converts them into taxable income. The Tribunal held that corpus retains its exempt character when used as per donor directions and trust deed. The post Corpus Fund Withdrawal Not Taxable When Used for Charitable Objects: ITAT Chennai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Failure to Spend and Transfer CSR Amount
articles.summary: The adjudicating authority penalised a company for not spending mandatory CSR funds and failing to transfer unspent amounts on time. Subsequent rectification did not erase liability for the original default. The post Penalty Imposed for Failure to Spend and Transfer CSR Amount appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Lesser Penalty Imposed for Incorrect Registered Office Filing by Startup
articles.summary: A company was penalised for filing an incomplete and incorrect INC-22 for change of registered office. Startup status helped secure a reduced penalty under Section 446B. The post Lesser Penalty Imposed for Incorrect Registered Office Filing by Startup appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Beyond 3 Years Upheld as Escapement Exceeded ₹50 Lakh — Cash Deposits u/s 69A
articles.summary: The issue was whether reassessment after three years was barred by limitation. The Tribunal held it valid since the escaped income exceeded ₹50 lakh, attracting the extended reopening window. The post Reassessment Beyond 3 Years Upheld as Escapement Exceeded ₹50 Lakh — Cash Deposits u/s 69A appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 270A Penalty Deleted for Suo Motu Withdrawal of Education Cess Claim
articles.summary: The tribunal held that penalty under Section 270A cannot be levied where the assessee voluntarily withdrew the education cess claim after a retrospective amendment. A bona fide claim made on prevailing judicial views does not amount to under-reporting or misreporting. The post Section 270A Penalty Deleted for Suo Motu Withdrawal of Education Cess Claim appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ROC imposes Penalty for Incorrect MGT-7A Filing Despite Timely Submission
articles.summary: Errors and omissions in the annual return were held to violate Section 92. Even timely filing does not cure defective disclosures, though penalties were reduced for a startup. The post ROC imposes Penalty for Incorrect MGT-7A Filing Despite Timely Submission appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Using Private Placement Funds Before Statutory Filing
articles.summary: The adjudicating authority held that utilisation of application money before filing PAS-3 violates Section 42. Even procedural deviations in private placement can trigger substantial penalties. The post Penalty Imposed for Using Private Placement Funds Before Statutory Filing appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Missing Disclosures in Preferential Allotment Filing
articles.summary: Failure to attach the EGM notice and explanatory statement in statutory filings was held to violate Rule 13(d). The key takeaway is that procedural lapses attract penalties even where shareholder approval exists. The post Penalty Imposed for Missing Disclosures in Preferential Allotment Filing appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty u/s 271(1)(c) Not Sustainable on Estimated/40(a)(ia)/41(1) Additions: ITAT Agra
articles.summary: The case examined penalty levied on estimated additions and statutory disallowance. The Tribunal held that neither category amounts to concealment or inaccurate particulars. The post Penalty u/s 271(1)(c) Not Sustainable on Estimated/40(a)(ia)/41(1) Additions: ITAT Agra appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 43B Relief Granted Because Evidence of Gratuity Payment Was Ignored
articles.summary: The decision underscores that ignoring audited disclosures, ledgers, and salary records violates principles of natural justice. Once actual payment is proved, gratuity deduction must be allowed. The post Section 43B Relief Granted Because Evidence of Gratuity Payment Was Ignored appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Private Placement of Shares Without Mandatory Valuation Report
articles.summary: The regulator held that issuing securities through private placement without a registered valuer’s report violates Section 62(1)(c). A reduced penalty was imposed considering start-up status. The post Penalty Imposed for Private Placement of Shares Without Mandatory Valuation Report appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ₹25 Lakh Penalty Imposed for Failure to Appoint Mandatory Company Secretary
articles.summary: A company was penalised for long-term non-compliance with mandatory appointment of a Company Secretary. The order reiterates strict enforcement of Section 203 of the Companies Act. The post ₹25 Lakh Penalty Imposed for Failure to Appoint Mandatory Company Secretary appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITAT Rajkot Quashes Copy-Paste Appellate Order Citing Wrong AY/Facts
articles.summary: The issue was an appellate order passed with facts, year, and income of another assessee. The Tribunal held the order void and directed a fresh decision in the correct case. The post ITAT Rajkot Quashes Copy-Paste Appellate Order Citing Wrong AY/Facts appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: CAAR Mumbai Rejected Advance Ruling Due to Ongoing Customs Investigation
articles.summary: The authority refused to issue an advance ruling after finding that the same issue was already under investigation by customs officers. The ruling reiterates that pending investigations bar maintainability under Section 28-I. The post CAAR Mumbai Rejected Advance Ruling Due to Ongoing Customs Investigation appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Minor Valuation Difference Cannot Justify Capital Gains Addition: ITAT Surat
articles.summary: ITAT held that when the same property valuation has been accepted in co-owners’ cases, a contrary view cannot be taken for another co-owner. Consistency in tax treatment is mandatory. The post Minor Valuation Difference Cannot Justify Capital Gains Addition: ITAT Surat appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penny Stock LTCG Held Genuine Despite Investigation Reports: ITAT Mumbai
articles.summary: The tribunal held that suspicion, abnormal price rise, or third-party reports are insufficient to deny LTCG exemption. Revenue must establish direct involvement of the taxpayer in price rigging. The post Penny Stock LTCG Held Genuine Despite Investigation Reports: ITAT Mumbai appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 68 Addition Set Aside as Onus of Proof Was Discharged
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that once the assessee proves identity, genuineness, and source through documents and bank records, the burden shifts to the Revenue. Without rebuttal of evidence, addition under Section 68 cannot survive. The post Section 68 Addition Set Aside as Onus of Proof Was Discharged appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.summary: A consultation paper proposes expanding sustainable finance rules in GIFT IFSC. It introduces sustainable deposits and stronger governance for green lending and investments. articles.summary: The consultation paper proposes strict oversight of algorithmic trading to curb volatility, manipulation, and system risks. articles.summary: ITAT ruled that the AO’s omission to apply TDS provisions on freight charges warrants revision.
